text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Group 0..*GroupGroup of multiple entities
id 0..1stringGroup UUID
Slices for extension 1..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Open by value:url
group-address S1..1AddressGroup Address
URL: https://openimis.github.io/openimis_fhir_r4_ig/StructureDefinition/group-address
group-poverty-status 0..1booleanGroup Poverty Status
URL: https://openimis.github.io/openimis_fhir_r4_ig/StructureDefinition/group-poverty-status
group-type 0..1CodeableConceptGroup Type
URL: https://openimis.github.io/openimis_fhir_r4_ig/StructureDefinition/group-type
Binding: Group Type (Group) (example)
group-confirmation 0..1(Complex)Group Confirmation
URL: https://openimis.github.io/openimis_fhir_r4_ig/StructureDefinition/group-confirmation
Slices for identifier S1..*IdentifierUnique id
Slice: Unordered, Closed by value:type.coding.code
identifier:All Slices Content/Rules for all slices
type 1..1CodeableConceptDescription of identifier
coding
code 0..1codeSymbol in syntax defined by the system
Binding: openIMIS Identifiers Value Set (required)
value 1..1stringThe value that is unique
identifier:Code S1..1IdentifierUnique id
type
coding
code 1..1codeGroup openIMIS Code
Required Pattern: Code
identifier:UUID 0..1IdentifierUnique id
type
coding
code 1..1codeGroup openIMIS UUID
Required Pattern: UUID
active 0..1booleanActive Policy
type 1..1codeperson | animal | practitioner | device | medication | substance
Required Pattern: person
actual 1..1booleanDescriptive or actual
Required Pattern: true
code 0..0
name 0..1stringGroup/Family official name
quantity 1..1unsignedIntNumber of members
managingEntity 0..0
characteristic 0..0
member 1..*BackboneElementWho or what is in group
entity 1..1Reference(openIMIS Patient)Reference to the group member
period 0..0
inactive 0..0

Documentation for this format

name: OpenIMISGroup
title: openIMIS Group
description: Defines a Group for openIMIS which maps to an Family

element.definition: Represents a defined collection of entities that may be discussed or acted upon collectively but which are not expected to act collectively, and are not formally or legally recognized; i.e. a collection of entities that isn't an Organization.
element.comment: If both Group.characteristic and Group.member are present, then the members are the individuals who were found who met the characteristic.  It's possible that there might be other candidate members who meet the characteristic and aren't (yet) in the list.  All members SHALL have the listed characteristics.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.xpath: not(exists(for $id in f:contained/*/f:id/@value return $contained[not(parent::*/descendant::f:reference/@value=concat('#', $contained/*/id/@value) or descendant::f:reference[@value='#'])]))

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management
Can only have members if group is "actual"

element.definition: Group/Family UUID generated by openIMIS.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.definition: An Extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Specifies the Group's address. Must contain at least the Location reference.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Specifies the Group's poverty status.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Specifies the Group's type.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Specifies the Group's confirmation number and type.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.definition: Mentions if the Group/Family has an Active Policy.
element.requirements: Need to be able to mark a group record as not to be used because it was created in error or is otherwise no longer available (e.g. a herd that no longer exists).
element.meaningWhenMissing: This resource is generally assumed to be active if no value is provided for the active element

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: If true, indicates that the resource refers to a specific group of real individuals.  If false, the group defines a set of intended individuals.
element.requirements: There are use-cases for groups that define specific collections of individuals, and other groups that define "types" of intended individuals.  The requirements for both kinds of groups are similar, so we use a single resource, distinguished by this flag.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Provides a specific type of resource the group includes; e.g. "cow", "syringe", etc.
element.comment: This would generally be omitted for Person resources.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Kind of particular resource; e.g. cow, syringe, lake, etc.

element.definition: Group/Family name based on Patient/Insuree official family and given names.
element.requirements: Used to identify the group in human communication.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A count of the number of resource instances that are part of the group.
element.comment: Note that the quantity may be less than the number of members if some of the members are not active.
element.requirements: Group size is a common defining characteristic.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Entity that is the custodian of the Group's definition
element.definition: Entity responsible for defining and maintaining Group characteristics and/or registered members.
element.comment: This does not strictly align with ownership of a herd or flock, but may suffice to represent that relationship in simple cases. More complex cases will require an extension.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Include / Exclude group members by Trait
element.definition: Identifies traits whose presence r absence is shared by members of the group.
element.comment: All the identified characteristics must be true for an entity to a member of the group.
element.requirements: Needs to be a generic mechanism for identifying what individuals can be part of a group.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: ./playedRole[isNormalRole()]/participation[isNormalParticipation() and typeCode="SBJ"]/act[isNormalAct and classCode="OBS" and moodCode="EVN"]

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: A code that identifies the kind of trait being asserted.
element.requirements: Need a formal way of identifying the characteristic being described.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: List of characteristics used to describe group members; e.g. gender, age, owner, location, etc.

element.definition: The value of the trait that holds (or does not hold - see 'exclude') for members of the group.
element.comment: For Range, it means members of the group have a value that falls somewhere within the specified range.
element.requirements: The value of the characteristic is what determines group membership.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Value of descriptive member characteristic; e.g. red, male, pneumonia, Caucasian, etc.

element.definition: If true, indicates the characteristic is one that is NOT held by members of the group.
element.comment: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications cannot wrongly include excluded members as included or vice versa.
element.requirements: Sometimes group membership is determined by characteristics not possessed.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Period over which characteristic is tested
element.definition: The period over which the characteristic is tested; e.g. the patient had an operation during the month of June.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Who or what is in group
element.definition: Identifies the resource instances that are members of the group.
element.requirements: Often the only thing of interest about a group is "who's in it".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: A reference to the entity that is a member of the group. Must be consistent with Group.type. If the entity is another group, then the type must be the same.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Period member belonged to the group
element.definition: The period that the member was in the group, if known.
element.requirements: Need to track who was in a group at a  particular time.
element.meaningWhenMissing: The member is in the group at this time

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: If member is no longer in group
element.definition: A flag to indicate that the member is no longer in the group, but previously may have been a member.
element.requirements: Sometimes you don't know when someone stopped being in a group, but not when.
element.meaningWhenMissing: Members are considered active unless explicitly specified otherwise

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Group/Family UUID generated by openIMIS.
Specifies the Group's address. Must contain at least the Location reference.
Specifies the Group's poverty status.
Specifies the Group's type.
Specifies the Group's confirmation number and type.
Code of Group/Family member. By default is the Head of Family Insuree Code.
Group/Family UUID generated by openIMIS.
Mentions if the Group/Family has an Active Policy.
Group/Family name based on Patient/Insuree official family and given names.
